website_summaries.verdict: This lightweight aluminum alloy set is perfect for one person. Just be careful you don't get the handles too close to a flame.
pros: Total weight of the set is 7.9 oz
Comes with 2 pieces: an aluminum alloy pot, and an aluminum alloy bowl
Accessories include a mesh carrying bag and a loofah cleaning sponge
cons: Some reports that these arrived damaged
Plastic handles can easily catch fire

customer_reviews.title: Great set for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've taken this little set out three times now, once for a six-day through-hike, and it's worked wonderfully! I love the graduated measurements inside the pot and the fact the fuel canister fits perfectly inside it. (One word of warning- don't leave the fuel canister inside for storage as the metal ring on the bottom will rust and stain the inside of the pot.) The rubber coating on the handles helps with grip and avoiding heat transfer from my MSR stove, which is a huge plus, and it packs up so compactly and lightly for storage. I'm planning to order another set for my son, as this set far outperformed his older camp cookset in both usability and weight.
customer_reviews.author: K. Grissom

customer_reviews.title: ... on a backpacking trip and tested this out and love it. Its light and comes with a little ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently went on a backpacking trip and tested this out and love it. Its light and comes with a little mesh bag to carry it in, which came in handy since the top pot doesn't seal to the bottom pot. A plus is that I was able to save room in my backpack by placing the propane tank and stove inside the pots. I've only boiled water in this but it worked great for what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: April_

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: This less expensive cook set works well for me. I can fit my stove, lighter and fuel inside it, making it everything I need to cook. It boils enough water for a two person meal and the cup acts like a lid as well. It fits on top of my MSR Whipser very nicely. I could find lighter options, but the price goes up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: Great little product. This really fit the bill for my camping equipment. The bottom pot is nice and wide and the measurement hash marks on the inside make using it a breeze. The whole thing does not take up hardly any room and is made well. The handles are firm and secure I had no problem boiling water in the pot and pouring into other containers.
customer_reviews.author: Insane Irish

customer_reviews.title: Very good pot
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my favorite pot. I’ve had others and I’ve liked them as well. But this one is my go to. If you’re like me and want a cup of coffee and breakfast too thin this is perfect. I’ve had single pots to cook breakfast (usually instant oats) and a collapsible cup for my coffee. This you get the bigger pot to cook breakfast and the smaller for your morning coffee. Plus you can put your fuel canister inside plus other items (spork, rag, stove) makes it very compact. I’ve got other cook systems that are a bit lighter, but I can definitely justify the extra 2-3 ounces for this guy because it’s just fantastic...
customer_reviews.author: Jamoll

customer_reviews.title: Good for boiling water!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool compact pots. Held up nicely with boiling water... not so much with other food. It burns too easily and is very hard to clean. The bottom already has a burn spot where the flame hits it. Can't speak for their longevity. If you're doing serious camp cooking these are not for you! Otherwise pretty good bang for buck.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: works well with propane/butane containers.
customer_reviews.text: Great to cook most backpacking/ camping meals on. Allows you to carry less weight on your trips using dehydrated foods or foods like rice/oats that need hydration. Like the way fuel canisters and lighting setup fit into the containers. Have considered alcohol cooking but feel it only saves about 4-5 oz in weight if any, but there's the recycling issue.
customer_reviews.author: augustus

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camping kitchen set!
customer_reviews.text: This camping set is amazing! I’ve used it a ton of times for making food on the trail. Very easy to clean and has measuring lines inside to eliminate the guesswork. I cut off the rubber handles to expose the stainless steel for cooking over open fires. It has enough room inside that I keep my 230gram fuel can, a small sponge, some tea packets, salt packets, tapatio packets, honey packets, a folding spork, and my Elekticity camp stove all inside the camp stove set. A full mess kit inside this thing. Can’t recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great set for any camper/hiker/hunter.
customer_reviews.text: Good solid product. I'm a big camper/hiker and wanted something smaller to put in my pack and this is the best I could find for the price. Seems solid and good quality. The pans don't snap together or anything which is fine because it comes with a nice mesh bag to hold them. I clip the bag on my pack and I don't even know it's there. To utilize more space I put some utensils and napkins inside the pans. Very glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these pots
customer_reviews.text: Love these pots. We used on a camping trip to heat water for coffee, dehydrated pouch food and oatmeal. The handles are a little weird make sure they are pulled out right sometimes they will slip in to place while holding. imagine there being boiling hot water then the handles slip? Just be be careful. Other than that they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I bikepack and weight and convenience is a factor. The Wuudi is perfect. I can fit a can of fuel and a mini burner inside of the set. They got it right splitting the 1/3, 2/3 ratio in volume, it's nice to have a drink while you are cooking in the larger part. FYI - Food heats up very quickly because the metal is thin, you have to watch it. To get a 5 star rating they will have to come up with a way to have the two parts clamp together when stored. If they are out of the mesh bag provided they will come apart... quickly. All and all though, for the price it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light cooking.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, compact and you can load kit inside of it. Heats and cleans well. But, be careful of flame height on sides as the plastic handle coating will melt and burn off of the handles. Large pot holds enough food for two servings, smaller on could serve an oversized coffee cup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on my hunting/camping trip
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a week and made a lot of meals using an etekcity mini stove. The mini stove, base, and a jet fuel 100g canister fit inside to you can have everything in it you need.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Worked for Winter Backpacking
customer_reviews.text: The water heated to a boil fairly quickly with the temperature outside at 28 degrees Fahrenheit and no breeze. At 45 degrees and windy enough to blow over the pots before I put water in it was heating very slowly, but a foil wind block sped it up to about the same rate as with no wind at 28.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Redmond

customer_reviews.title: Hell yes. Buy this.
customer_reviews.text: I mean, super simple, super cheap. I use mine with a little camp stove and cup, which both fit inside of this little kit. I have just about everything I need packed into this. Add fuel, and go. I'm not cooking gourmet meals in these two pots, but coffee, water, easy stuff is a snap! Handles don't transfer heat, sturdy and cheap. I love my little "to go" rig, and this is a great part of it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Ernst

customer_reviews.title: Good cooking pots for the backpacker.
customer_reviews.text: I've used these on all my camping trips recently with both a butane/propane backpacking stove and directly over a fire. They're light and I can put my stove, small coffe mug, and rag inside of them and pack it nicely in my pack. I like that the bigger one has measurements on the side. Only thing I'm not a big fan of is the rubberized coating on the handles, have to be careful when you're using it over a camp fire or it could melt off. That's mostly a preference thing though, it's been a good product for me.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Much better than scrounging for tin cans in the wild. Compact size allows for inside storing of possibles. Mice wont get to your fave Reece's PB cups and Slim Jims. And mesh bags enables air drying.
customer_reviews.author: HeR3tic

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for the price. The finish has some imperfections, and I had to give it a good washing to remove a sticky residue from the factory. The handles are coated, and seem sturdy. Overall, I am happy. I measured the volume/capacity (to the brim) with a measuring cup. The bottom holds 1070mL, and the top holds 530mL. I am able to fit a GSI Hallulite Minimalist II inside, which holds my fuel and stove, and I put a set of fuel stabilizer legs on top. Everything nests together nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Mihail Schoolov

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I would give five stars but there is one annoying thing.. you can’t secure the two pots together. So unless you have some band or tape they come apart making it impractical for putting stuff inside and carry without planning for that. However, it is light, sturdy and pretty fantastic value.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cook set
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I was able to fit my folding stove stand, 4 ounce fuel can, Etekcity camp stove, AND MSR folding spork in this. Super compact and worked great for boiling water. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: ... break your bank to have a versatile camping gear like this outdoor camping pots
customer_reviews.text: You don't need to break your bank to have a versatile camping gear like this outdoor camping pots. You will get pretty much the same quality stuff from the brand-name products but with a fraction of what you need to pay. It comes with a mesh bag and can't be easily stored in your backpack. The color of handle is bright green and can be easily folded. Both the inside and outside are no-sticky surface and make the pots very easy to clean. I can't wait to try them during my next camp trip.
customer_reviews.author: Ming Lei

customer_reviews.title: plastic handle burns
customer_reviews.text: i want to like this pot set. i do. its a good size, it’s relatively lightweight. however, if you boil with the handle together, the metal will melt the plastic if its touching it. (if the handles overlap) this seems like a design error to me. moreover, the handle doesn’t clasp tightly enough to be a stable handle. could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Second backpacking trip and no issues so far. Easy to clean, durable, lightweight, and comes with a mesh bag. My fuel canister and stove fits in it too. If it breaks or something else happens to it, I’ll buy another set. Can’t beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: C. Burks

customer_reviews.title: An added latch would be nice.
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars because I've not yet used it, but so far pros are: small and lightweight, and can fit a couple cans of sterno in it for storage; con: unless I connect them together, they do not stay attached, even in the bag. An added latch would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: Good pot. Does what it's supposed to do. Use wooded utensils if possible. Wooded utensils reduce scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest F. Bazzinotti Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Nice inexpensive cook set
customer_reviews.text: Holding up much better tgan i thought it would big pot has enough room to make 2 boxes of mac and cheese (my daughters favorite trail lunch) small pot is excelent for a quick boil to make 1 nice cup of coffee also works well if you nest it to strain your noodles. Rubber handles are a hair too close to the pot as the flame can reach them not a huge deal only had the problem once and learned not to turn it up so high pot cools to be re palpable crazy fast.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Size not practical
customer_reviews.text: The size is so small, you're lucky if you get get a full bowl of soup on the small one, and there's not room for two servings of soup in the larger pot. Not sure what I would actually cook in these pots - there's no lid.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you simply can not beat the quality you’re getting. They work great with portable propane camp burners. Direct flame did not damage it any way. Easy to clean as long as you don’t burn food in it.
customer_reviews.author: Gage

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, lightweight and versatile! I strongly suggest purchasing the recommended fuel canister because I used something slightly different (larger) and melted a part of the rubber handle cover. Also, this is perfect for one person but I should have bought 2 sets for my fiance and I to use - sharing one was difficult!
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Studaker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camping pots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my brother and ended up keeping them!! My camp stove fits inside and they have great volume and the handles are decent.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W.

customer_reviews.title: I purchased twice
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this cookware. Very light weight and coveys heat quickly and evenly. Just the right size to nest a fuel canister inside while packing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for cooking my sooup and stew while hiking ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for cooking my sooup and stew while hiking and camping.Sometimes I use it on my back patio when I don't want to mess up the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for backpacking and it worked out pretty well. It's not too big or small. For the price it was well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for camping
customer_reviews.text: These compact pots were ideal to boil water at a campsite on my portable camp stove. Worried the rubber would melt like others claimed, just didn't happen which made me happy!
customer_reviews.author: C. Lew

customer_reviews.title: Perfect backpacking cookware
customer_reviews.text: Light weight cookware for you next backpacking trip, you can probably put you stove inside it to protect it from damage.
customer_reviews.author: J. K. Holzapfel

customer_reviews.title: Nice pots
customer_reviews.text: They are for bug out bag never used them yet !
customer_reviews.author: concho

customer_reviews.title: Small tweak needed
customer_reviews.text: I like to really crank up the flame on my mini stove so it began to burn the coating on the handles. I just trimmed the coating back about an inch and problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Coalcreeker

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: I can carry my gas, stove, cup, tripod and spoon all in the Pot and bag! It works so well I bought a second one for my daughter and she loves it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Untested, but seems serviceable
customer_reviews.text: Metal feels pretty soft. In testing the stability of the pot, it easily took a permanent thumb dent. I wasn’t trying to do that either. Very light though and will be a good item to test as I begin bushcraft.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Saves the World

customer_reviews.title: Room to store gas and stove inside
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, sturdy. Will fit a gas canister and mini stove inside, super convenient! Don't forget to fold out the handles, the covering will melt quickly on stove.
customer_reviews.author: SticNmove

customer_reviews.title: ... guys on a recent backpacking trip and was quite pleased. They fit well on my Svea 123R and ...
customer_reviews.text: Took these guys on a recent backpacking trip and was quite pleased. They fit well on my Svea 123R and the lids worked nicely keeping ash out an open fire. Light weight and you can easily hang dry them by clipping the handle over the line.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Jurdan

customer_reviews.title: Great set.
customer_reviews.text: I cook over wood so the handle coating is burned off. Great for regular stoves though. Compact, durable. Much better design to have the lid also function as a cup or bowl. I like mine a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent Size
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tested it out while backpacking yet, but it boiled water well enough with my stove in my living room. Fits my stove & fuel so it is a great space saver. Will come back and update once I've used it outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: Cool small portable pots for a one person meal NOTE super good for anything you need a lid for like rice.just put small pot on top of big pot
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camping equipment
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this camping Pot/lid for a couple years now and I have to say I still love it. I’ve done everything in this thing: cooked on a stove, fire, and Coleman burner. I’ve lived out out this pot for over a week, and it has never let me down. It’s the perfect size for a small fuel canister and stand to be stored inside for easy travel that saves room.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy I

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2. I love the sturdiness of them. The color is good too. I'd purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Platinum J

customer_reviews.title: Nice Set
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected, but worked fine for me. You have to watch your food close, because if it burns, the pots are hard to clean. But overall they did what I needed and were easy to pack and carry.
customer_reviews.author: scott gills

customer_reviews.title: they held up
customer_reviews.text: these held up well on our 8 day trip to the BWCA. I was able to fit two small tanks inside. I was very happy with them
customer_reviews.author: jim h.

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with the handles
customer_reviews.text: Size and weight were great. Bought two. Handles melted on one making it unusable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Nice backpacking cookware for one person....compact,light weight,and durable. Perfect size for backpacking stove. This is an excellent product at a great price Definitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Neil Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a day and used it 4 times already to boil water. Works great. Seems to be built from quality material.
customer_reviews.author: coors247

customer_reviews.title: sturdy but would not click and hold together
customer_reviews.text: the two pots only sit on top of each other they do not interlock together. they do come with a mesh bag that they both fit into but the pots quickly come apart. worked great for just what i needed. the rubber handles did melt due to the flame size but that could of been my fault. these pots were perfect size for two people backpacking
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Took on two trips so far, a 120-mile bike trip, and a backpacking trip. Fits the mini burner and mixed fuel perfectly inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amaroq45

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great the little one tips over if it’s empty by the weight of the handles but otherwise works great
customer_reviews.author: Bob Orr

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little cooking pan! It'll be great over my fading sterno stove! Well made!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well as a camping pot with my alcohol stove ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well as a camping pot with my alcohol stove. The only con is that the rubber handles will burn any time the cooking flame licks up the side of the pot. This happened the 4th or 5th time I used this. You might want to take a knife and shave off an inch or so of the rubber handle.
customer_reviews.author: Madrog

customer_reviews.title: Good value for price.
customer_reviews.text: You can pack both your MSR canister and your stove top into the pots. The pots are non-stick. We ran out of gas and had to put the pots directly over the fire, which melted the non-stick coating on the outside. We then moved the pots 6 inches from the fire and our food cooked up beautifully, if a little slowly. Definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my use
customer_reviews.text: Great little addition to my kit. Light weight, but strong and easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Bob in GA

customer_reviews.title: Good, quality mess kit for hiking.
customer_reviews.text: I love this mess kit. It is compact and has a great carry bag. Easily fits into a side pocket of a hiking pack and very lightweight. It would be nice to have a latch that keeps the two parts together, but good item.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Nice set
customer_reviews.text: Will work good for my emergency kit. Big enough to cook or good for heating water.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hernandezrodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Nice mesh bag
customer_reviews.text: Scratches and dints very easy only kept it because i liked the mesh bag it came in amd wanted to use it for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny m

customer_reviews.title: Buy these pots. Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product. There's nothing negative I can say out these pots. They are durable and hold up really well. They did not corrode when exposed to the elements and are built with solid materials.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You need this.
customer_reviews.text: This combined with the Reehut Ultralight Portable camp stove is a game changer. It fits in the pots! Highly recommend. Bigger pot fits more than a cans worth of food/water in it.
customer_reviews.author: Aleena Watson

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have on the go for camping. Works well and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kacia

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I lovvvvvvvvvve these so much. Super useful and come with a bag to store them in. Super cheap but good quality, Definitely recommend over spending a fortune at REI.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary Hannah Neilson

customer_reviews.title: Great for price!
customer_reviews.text: Cant beat the price, since it's not non stick I only really boil water in it to rehydrate food. Measurements are helpful. Rubber on handles will melt a little just use caution to expose to direct flame.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Creasman

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: This will be used in the fall on an excurison. It seems to be of good quality for what it is made to do and it is a space saver.
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Used during coachella, great lightweight addition
customer_reviews.text: Great size, compact, easy to clean light weight but durable, make sure you keep the handles away from flame as they can burn. Handle design very convenient. Must have when camping and needing to travel light.
customer_reviews.author: Aileen

customer_reviews.title: Great for packpacking!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, comes just as described. I used on an alcohol burning pepsi can stove that I made and it boiled water well. Unfortunately my fire got a little out of control and I burnt the plastic on the handle a little bit :/ (my fault, not the pot's fault)
customer_reviews.author: Zach Brom

customer_reviews.title: Handel coating will melt
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like this cook set, however; I would omit the plastic coating on the handles. I put mine into a fire without thinking (to cook eggs), and it melted the handels. I had to cut the plastic off. Luckily it is okay underneath, and I actually prefer it this way; as I bring oven mits anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa keller

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made for price but I won't be using it till early Oct 2016. Will try to give update on it later. Seems to be made out of same material and has same weight as big brand name ones costing a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: nytehawk

customer_reviews.title: Ok in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: Yeah not my choice for anything heavy or medium duty. Best used at a bowl for soup or something and not so much for cooking.
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice little camping pots... enough for one person... comes with nice carrying pouch... heavy duty and good looking...
customer_reviews.author: kikker

customer_reviews.title: Great product ... you'll luv it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size ... Stove, fuel cannister and fuel cannister support piece all manage to fit inside. Grrreat for my motorcycle adventure rides.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Happy I have it. Bought 2.
customer_reviews.text: Good for emergency kit or camping, hiking, etc. Light weight. Sets well on small hiker stove.
customer_reviews.author: Busymomma

customer_reviews.title: Great cookware for the money
customer_reviews.text: I used this camping cookware on my last camping trip. The cookware is sturdy and very nice for the money spent. I would recommend for anyone who is looking for quality budget cookware.
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: Good for camping
customer_reviews.text: Product is very lightweight, made pretty sturdy. The price is great for camping stuff. I used it once in a backpack hiking trip, pretty happy so far. The paint seems to get scratched easily, but I think it will last long time.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Good for camping.
customer_reviews.text: Used this recently and really happy with it. A little more expensive for what it is. I saw a very similar product at Walmart for a couple dollars less.
customer_reviews.author: ART

customer_reviews.title: Perfect starter set
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I can fit my stove, fuel, and windscreen inside to have my whole camping kitchen as one super compact unit. The coated handles work great, and I’ve used them on now 2 trips and I know they have a good life left. Great starter set!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Backpacking Pots
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use it on a trip, but it is compact, lightweight, and looks to be the perfect one-person size.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L. Laughman

customer_reviews.title: works great. fits my entire cooking set inside it
customer_reviews.text: works great. fits my entire cooking set inside it. Only problem so far is that the plastic handle cover melted off.
customer_reviews.author: 444fox

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great price!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this set for a couple of years now and it’s held up really well and works great. Have taken it on lots of backpacking trips and I love that it’s an affordable price for good quality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a good Out door cook set for a 1 peson Backing trip. I use mine on cook propain stove and exclent. Even easy to melt snow into water. Found no problems. Thank You Amazon
customer_reviews.author: John shook

customer_reviews.title: Nice if you want a deeper pot than most kits
customer_reviews.text: Nice if you want a deeper pot than most kits, I fit my stove, fuel can and other utensils inside it
customer_reviews.author: earl s sahli

customer_reviews.title: Cook while backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Have used several times, they work great! they are the perfect shape to keep the fuel canister as well as the burner inside the two pots. Opposite pot doubles as a lid when cooking.
customer_reviews.author: CkWorld

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly as it describes which is more than handy when buying on amazon :) highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Cadence

customer_reviews.title: Great little set
customer_reviews.text: Nice little pots for camping or backpacking, it also comes with a little bag to keep them together. I can't wait to try them out. I will update this if they don't gold up to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great for emergencies
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to attach on my emergency/survival bag. You never know when an emergency will arise and this helps me know I will be able to cook my food and boil water if I had too. Great quality, sturdy item!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Langwiser ☆

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used it yet but it was just what I thought it would be. It is made out of quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Richismo

customer_reviews.title: Loved this set
customer_reviews.text: Brought this on an 8 day hike of the NPT- the propane canister and stove fit neatly inside. Food cooked quickly and pots cleaned up easily with a little hot water and a quick wipe down.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Mashtare

customer_reviews.title: Worked well.  Gas canisters fit inside.
customer_reviews.text: These worked well. I used them on a backpacking trip. You can fit two gas canisters inside.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive buy
customer_reviews.text: I received this set in the mail, and was immediately pleased. The cookware is lightweight but appears durable. And considering the price, how can I go wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Clayton W

customer_reviews.title: Great all in one pot
customer_reviews.text: Volume is excellent... one fill for breakfast and a good amount of coffee
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Boiled a lot of water with no problems
customer_reviews.author: David Bottiglieri

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome! Took to the bottom of the Grand Canyon ...
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! Took to the bottom of the Grand Canyon with me. Light weight enough to backpack and durable enough to car camp with. Definitely a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Brady

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Really great product if you want save some money. If your wanting spend more im sure can go lighter but for a cook pot and a lid/cup or another cook pan it is awesome
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Crouch

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Small but handy for backpacking. Will hold about 2 cans of soup/campbells chunky
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Huffman

customer_reviews.title: this is a small pot, but can make a ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a small pot, but can make a single serving of soup, stew, etc. The lid becomes a plate/bowl, or can also be used to cook something.
customer_reviews.author: WNYKate

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Expected less and got more! How often does that happen.
customer_reviews.author: jason Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Light weight. I could store my cooking stove and a nca of fuel inside to save space.
customer_reviews.author: DPW

product_meta.title: wuudi Camping Equipment, Outdoor Camping Pots and Pans Set 2PCS Camping Cookware
product_meta.description: Product description Weight : 0.28KG The lid:115x60mm Pot size: 125x105mm Material: Aluminum alloy Wuddi Camping pot set will be a good gift for the funs of camping . Package include 1 X Camping Bowl 1 X Camping Pot
feature_bullets: INCREDIBLE VALUE-This two piece set (including the carry bag) is an incredible value for the money. You will get one Aluminum alloy pot,one Aluminum alloy bowls.It is perfect size for 1 youth scout or adult hiker backpacker.

DURABLE,COMPACT AND LIGHTWEIGHT-- It is incredible easy to clean this set with the included loofah cleaning sponge. The entire set weighs only 224g which is very lightweight and this set is extremely east to store and is compact. This set is perfect for camping, backpacking, hiking, emergency preparedness, or as part of a survival kit.

BACKPACKING NECESSITY--For the ourdoor activities who hikes, camps, you know that you need camping cookware. This set is perfect because of its small, compact size and incredible value. You are sure to love this camping cooking set. Both the pot and pan have folding handles for space saving and compactness.

THE PERFECT GIFT FOR THE OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES --This awesome camping cooking set makes a great gift for your friend or family who loves hiking, camping and backpacking. This is an essential part of necessary equipment for every outdoor enthusiast out there.When the cookset is fitted together (with the lid on the pot) for travel and storage, it contai room to carry a stove, matches, seasoning, salt, pepper, a sponge and many other things to keep your overall space coumption to a minimum.
Package include:1 X Camping Bowl and 1 X Camping Pot
